website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy stroller that offers the benefits of an umbrella stroller but with better stability.
pros: Handles are at a comfortable height
Folds down easily and reaches a small enough size for easy travel
Enough storage space for the essentials
cons: Some users found the crotch strap to be too short
Finish and durability of the handles has been a issue on a few units

customer_reviews.title: Beware Non Adjustable Handle Bars
customer_reviews.text: Handles are way too short... it's impossible to push without hunching over and tripping over the back wheels because they are so close to where I am walking. I used this stroller twice and hurt my back both times. I am 5'5" so this really should not be a problem for me. My husband cannot use it at all. Handles need to be adjustable. I had an older model Graco lightweight stroller for my now 10 year old that was much more comfortable and better made. I figured Chicco could at least make a comparable product but it also feels cheaper and less sturdy. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amara Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Waist strap too small for even a 7mo baby.
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this product, it's light, fold up easily, seems well made. However, the waist strap is extremely small. It's too small for my 7mo, 5th percentile baby. I have contacted Chicco to see if this is a manufacturing defect. If not, it will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product!
customer_reviews.text: Positive: it is light weight, well built, nice sunshade, convenient basket, and let's be honest I love the color! Has higher handles and are comfortable. Negative: is built for up to 40 pounds, but my 3 year old is the size of a 5 year old so he is almost too big, however I will use it anyway. Strap is almost too small. A little bulky. I still love it and it seems comfortable to my son. I would like a cup holder on it and it would be nice if it held a little more weight.
customer_reviews.author: Scsmith

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Broke th first time I used it! Handle snapped right off where it was bolted on to the frame. Chicco replaces it after 3 emails, having to cut it up and show proof I did so , and no apology. Horrible quality. Spend your money elsewhere .
customer_reviews.author: lindsay bohney

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and durable
customer_reviews.text: This stroller was purchased for my niece. So far we have been using for almost everything except trips to the mall. We have a larger stroller than we can fit bags into at the bottom however this one can only fit a small bag in it's basket. The orange color we got is beautiful and can work for either a boy or girl (not that it matters). It's pretty lightweight and super easy to fold and open up. I definitely recommend this stroller if you're going to the park , a walk, or somewhere you won't need to carry many things.
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than a $20 umbrella but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This a decent travel umbrella stroller. It is comfortable enough for my 18months old, 23 lbs baby. The bottom buckle should be redesigned to be a little longer to fit proportionally with the shoulder straps which is a bit long. It is also easy to pinch the finger trying to buckle the baby in. It is light, doesn't lay flat but does support the baby enough so the head doesn't fall forward when sleeping. It is good on pavement walk way, not really for off the road type of use. The handle is not very comfortable when pushing for longer than 45 min, but easy to carry when in collapse position.
customer_reviews.author: BelleSea

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: The harness on this is not adjustable especially at the waist/lap area! My child is 9 months and weighs 19lbs and it’s too tight for him. I am very disappointed in this purchase. I should have read the reviews but because of the brand I trusted they knew what they were doing.
customer_reviews.author: Cresencia Siguenza

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2 yr old needed it for travel. The seatbelt was too short and too tight unable to make it longer for him. My son is 30lbs and 36" tall nothing out of the ordinary. I liked the color selection and design reason for the 1 star. I returned it and purchased the Summer Infant lightweight stroller very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: March91306

customer_reviews.title: Crotch too tight - deal breaker
customer_reviews.text: As others mention crotch belt is too tight to the seat back. Not adjustable. Also the buckles are pinch inducing tough design. Feels like stroller of 20th century, when kids weren't so precious and there were lots of bad product design.
customer_reviews.author: canyon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stroller as we were very frustrated with the poor quality of other types of umbrella style strollers. It is the perfect stroller for travelling especially air travel. This stroller is wonderful!!! It is very easy to fold, lightweight and has a carry strap for easy transport. Shade is removeable. 2 position recline is sufficient-it does not fully recline. 5 point harness is perfect. My only issues would be a small basket size (although not unexpected given the type of stroller)-I can still fit a small diaper bag in the basket and when folded, the wheels touch the stroller canopy which gets the canopy dirty when then wheels are wet or dirty. Great product and value!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact stroller for trips when you want to pack ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact stroller for trips when you want to pack lite or just one you can keep in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Not good for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I love Chicco brand so figured I’d love this stroller but I don’t. My son is two and the seat belt on the longest position is too tight so he has to sit in it with seatbelt which doesn’t work long with a toddler!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gustine

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for BUT had to use a screw driver!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, super easy to assemble, & pretty much exactly what we were looking for (quick pop up stroller for shopping trips... we have a BOB and it’s just too big for this stuff). HOWEVER.... the waist straps were so tight that our pretty petite 1 yr old did not fit. We had to unscrew the straps and screw them back on opposite sides to make them long enough to adjust. Now that it’s “fixed” we love it! Not sure if it was a manufacturer error ....
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Paige

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller and good price
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. Lightweight and simple. Good for traveling. We bought it for the cruise for our almost 3 year old child. It reclines, it's cushiony, not too low handles, some storage (enough for this kind of stroller). Doesn't look or feel flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: epl53078

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for travel. Have not used it yet, but tested in the house with my 2 year old granson. First impressions are very good. Easy set up, easy to open and close, has a lock. Difficult to figure out where to snap canopy (snap very, very low, over fabric). Rolls very smooth. Nice bonus to get the travel case to keep it protected when checking at the gate. Very light and sturdy. Happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Cat-n-Rolly

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great except for two things
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except for two things. 1.) Not for tall people. When walking I have to extend my arms all the way out to prevent my feet from gracing the wheels. 2.) The canopy doesn't really protect my little one from the sun. It seems like it's there for show.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Fan of chicco
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is super light and handy to have for everyday use. I am glad I bought it. The only constructive criticism I have is the storage underneath doesn't fit much of anything and wished that it is built a little deeper to allow more storage room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This stellar is light, easy to use, easy to push, and so comfortable for our little guy! We had this stroller previous and it endured 3 kids over a 7 year period of time so I would say they hold up great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Lamonte

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as they say
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller based on rave reviews and I am very disappointed. The handles are short so if you are "tall" (I'm 5'7"), you have to hunch over to push the stroller. The harnesses inside the seat do not lengthen out as much as I expected so my 11 month old who is tall but not huge looks uncomfortable with the short straps pushing against his torso. It works for short trips, but if I had the choice to do it again, I would not buy this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: AMY L ZUANICH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stroller
customer_reviews.text: When we were looking at umbrella strollers, I was really hesitant to get a "cheap" stroller since I"ve seen so many of those $15 ones look like they'll just fall apart. We found this stroller and it has been great. Very sturdy and built to hold more weight without tipping over backwards if you're putting bags on the handles. You can unclip the shoulder harness if you so desire which was nice when he got older because the shoulder straps bugged him a lot. We've even bought this as a gift for a friend. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: MrsK

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 days at Disney
customer_reviews.text: The stroller aluminum snapped at the seat after only 3 days of heavy usage at Disney. The front wheels also go into lock mode frequent enough to make you frustrated trying to rush from place to place. The sun cover also never really feels like it is in the right position, especially if you plan on putting anything on the stroller handles. It is light weight and easy to fold up and down, and the color is pretty spectacular. But as far as taking it on a fast paced travel, I wouldn't describe this as a heavy duty umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ady Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended but a huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: this stroller broke and my grandson used it maybe twice. I was so surprised because it came so highly recommended. one of the arms that supports the seat broke off (it was aluminum). My grandson is lightweight (under 25 pounds). He liked to push the stroller rather than sit in it. However, Amazon Prime was very good in taking this return and sending me out another stroller exactly like the one I returned. I hope that this doesn't happen again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Brown

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Time Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is amazing. We had a red one and loaned it to a friend. She was hit by a car while walking and was seriously injured. The hospital told her that this stroller saved her baby's life. The stroller was totaled but we decided that we would get the exact same one again. The height is perfect for tall people (and short people) and it's nice to have a basket underneath which you don't usually see in umbrella strollers.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMomma

customer_reviews.title: It was super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is so much easier to handle than the heavy stroller that came with our infant 3 in 1 set. It was super easy to assemble.....less than 5 minutes. We only looked at the directions to fold it back down, Really love the carrying bag that was included. I absolutely love the quality and safety of chicco products.
customer_reviews.author: Philip3717

customer_reviews.title: Critical Design Defect : Waist Strap Far Too Short for Human Babies
customer_reviews.text: The length of the waist strap—when adjusted to its maximum—is only 14 inches. The average circumferential waist size of a newborn infant is 18 inches. And, of course, this stroller is not designed for newborn infants (the minimum age is 6 months). This represents a critical, if not fatal, design defect that makes this stroller unusable notwithstanding any other redeeming features is might offer.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I did not like it
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to use if the baby is sleeping
customer_reviews.author: CarmenNAME_NOT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella stroller. Has survived several international trips and is easily maneuverable on and off public transportation. I have a bad back, and this light stroller has been so helpful. Easy to maneuver and fold, and it’s so compact it fits practically anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Light weigh and well built. I take it everywhere when traveling and do daily walks (about 3-4 miles a day), still going strong. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller because it’s easy to fold and light to carry. I also love the fact that it reclines for my little one.
customer_reviews.author: YOLANDA GODINEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great color, awesome stroller
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this stroller. My husband is 6'3" and I'm 5'8" so the usual $15 umbrella stroller is too small and awkward for us. The height and width of this stroller is perfect. My son fits in it great and he's secure with the straps. I just wish it had the cup holders between the bars like most do, but you can find them and buy them pretty cheap on Amazon that snap on and the problem is solved.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Hildreth

customer_reviews.title: Overall quite pleased with this stroller.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stroller. It rides/drives nicely. It's sturdy. It seems to be good quality for the price. We had trouble finding an unbrella stroller that we liked as most out there are really cheap in price and construction or ridiculoulsy expensive for an umbrella stroller. The only one slight negative for this stoller is that for taller people it can be a bit akward. Both my husband and I are tall and we find that we often kick the back wheels. If the handle height/length was adjustable it might be better.
customer_reviews.author: Lady J

customer_reviews.title: My son hated it. He would cry every time we put ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and uncomfortable. My son hated it. He would cry every time we put him in it...he is 18 pounds, seven months old. It was very uncomfortable to push. My husband is 5'9 and I am 5'2. The sun shade is too short. The front wheel broke after one month of use. We trashed it and got a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: TravelRN

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy to take a lot👍
customer_reviews.text: It’s not as easy to use as our other stroller🙃
customer_reviews.author: Teresa robbins

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the other stroller we had was way too big to take with us on vacation with a lot of luggage. I thought I was buying the one that reclined but it turns out that that one is almost $200. Still for the price it's a very good umbrella stroller. It's compact, comes with a shoulder strap and storage bag. I like it a lot and would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out stroller, Chicco is always an 8 or 9 on their products.
customer_reviews.text: If can be bought at a deep discount, it is a good value. Not perfect, but great for trips and vacations.
customer_reviews.author: tony yu

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller.  Substantial but light.  Great price.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is very easy to use and to carry. My one year old is super comfortable in it, and the sun shade has good coverage. The storage is small, and I can understand why some people complain about kicking the wheels, or the handles not extending out far enough. For long walks we use a jogger stroller. This is perfect for errands, short outings, crowded spaces, airports, etc. It is SO SO SO much better than the cheapo flimsy kinds of umbrella strollers, and SO SO SO much more reasonable than paying $[...] for something just a tad bit fancier.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is the best investment I ever made in a stroller. I have a very expensive stroller at home which retails for $1200. When I had to travel internationally with my one year old daughter I could not take the Bugaboo because it was too big as a carry on so I decided to buy this one. I was looking for something in between terminals, but I ended up using it everywhere in Europe and when I came back to the States I still use it to do everything. It is light, easy to flip open or close it, fits everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: gincoolette

customer_reviews.title: Proportions are off
customer_reviews.text: Quality is good but the handles are low and I feel like my feet constantly hit the stroller when walking. I'm only 5ft tall and have trouble pushing it comfortable and my husband refuses to use it. Something is off with the proportions.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but the main buckle is an atrocity
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but the main buckle is an atrocity. It's tough to work with even for me - a healthy adult male. It takes a few swear words from my wife to unlatch it, and our babysitter, an aging lady, simply cannot deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Study, lightweight, easy to open/close. Good for an umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.text: My friend really liked this. If she were taller, she might not bc she would kick her foot into it. And there isn't really any useful cargo space below. But, she bought it despite those things and still likes it. Sturdy. Super lightweight. Easy to open/close. One issue she's uncovered is that it is difficult to push with one hand. That would be a problem with any umbrella stroller, however, because the handle bars are not connected.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: is super light weight that why i order it . i don't have to carry heavy stroller no more
customer_reviews.author: Dalia

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great. Folds down and opens real fast. Lightweight. The cover it comes with is great for flights. However, if you are taller than 5'7-5'8 your legs will kick the wheels as you push the stroller, so consider that before you buy. I've had it for a while now and used it a lot for trips.
customer_reviews.author: PG, CA

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for grandma's car!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller ! It is lightweight and easy to set up, fits great in the car and stays clean in its case. Also has two back height adjustments for babies that sit and those that don't.
customer_reviews.author: Esh

customer_reviews.title: Good all round
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stroller for a Disney Trip. Folds up tightly which as a plus for limited cargo space in the car. Stroller rolls well as compared to my sisters $200+ Maclaren. Only negative is I am 5'11" and constantly kick the rear wheels. Stroller is a comfortable height, but the rear wheels need to be rotated 180 deg.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great light weight and portable stroller for occasional use with the grandkids. The carrying bag is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: a decent travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: we purchased this stroller because we had an international flight planned. the stroller is light, easily foldable and reclines.it has a canopy and a tiny basket. you can't store anything on the handles because the stroller is too light. I would buy it again. it does wit a travel bag but when we picked it up from the baggage claim, it had a whole in it..not very sturdy fabric I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrella Stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a good heavy duty stroller to use with toddlers. It has outlasted my son, who is now too big for it. It is also easily maneuverable on the sidewalk and road. It doesn't work well on trails because of the double wheels. One warning though, if you're tall the handles do not extend so you end up stooping.
customer_reviews.author: S. Keaton

customer_reviews.title: She called me once she arrived saying it was easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My wife had me order this for a long trip she had to do with our 1 year old. She called me once she arrived saying it was easy to use, lightweight and comfortable for our sun. I would recommend this for travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Anello

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Love how lightweight it is. Easy to throw in the trunk. Easy to lift. But the straps are hard to monkey with sometimes. You can't get them out of way when you put your kid in the stroller because they fall on the seat. Also no cup storage whatsoever. No sippy cup holder no adult cup holder. No tray either.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for walking
customer_reviews.text: feet hit wheels when you walk. handles are far away from body, causing you to hunch over. it is very lightweight, and easy to fold. took on a trip through airports and train stations and it was very easy to travel with... BUT, the way its designed makes it impossible to walk with. we are trying to return it.
customer_reviews.author: oldOtter

customer_reviews.title: Used it at Disney World and it was comfortable, but bigger than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Used it at Disney World and it was comfortable, but bigger than I thought it would be. Good stroller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition: Love the Shoulder Strap for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sister as an extra stroller to have around and it has became her go to stroller! Great quality, very light and easy to bring anywhere we go! the additional bag for travel and shoulder strap really adds to the benefit of having this stroller around. would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Mikel

customer_reviews.title: Expected more for such an expensive umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: Crotch clip is way too short.. This stroller is overall comparable to $30 you would find in target. Waste of money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Good basic umbrella stroller with no thrills
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is good for a lightweight umbrella stroller, but don't expect too many bells and whistles. There is no cup holder or large basket to put items in the bottom. The handle bars don't allow you to hang anything to it either. We couldn't figure out where to snap a couple of the buttons on the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Ornojo

customer_reviews.title: It is lightweight but not very sturdy.. It's a bit difficult for me to ...
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight but not very sturdy.. It's a bit difficult for me to unfold and fold but it's ok for my husband. It's comfortable to my girl, 2T, but doesnt hold much else.
customer_reviews.author: sousr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lightweight Stroller
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this stroller is that there is no cup holder. Otherwise, easy to use, light (compared to my Graco Mosaic stroller, it's over a 10-15 pound difference) and the color rocks. My daughter seems comfortable and naps just fine in it. The straps are also easier to use than the Mosaic stroller. Steering is so easy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Kimsey

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall adults too
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella stroller on the market! This one for a friends baby shower and she can't say enough about r either. Folds up nice and lightweight. Good for tall people too
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Mills

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient in many occasions
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. It totally met my expectations for travel. Lightweight, easy to fold, strong enough and comfortable for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: EDWIN KWOK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect city stroller
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and sturdy stroller, easy to open and close and not too heavy, It was a gift for my niece’s baby and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mayda Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable procuct.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great for the price! The canopy was a little hard to figure out but it is very durable and my little one loves it. It folds up easily and love that it comes with the carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Falln2far

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stroller!
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller!!!! It is great for travel. It will never trump our Chicco full size stroller but it is wonderful for road trip and plane trip travels!
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good Lightweight stroller
customer_reviews.text: I live on the third floor and carry this up and down every day with my 3 month old. The back goes down just far enough for her to sit, and works great for my height (5'6"). I do kick the wheels if I'm taking full steps, but overall I love this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Janie S Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Okay stroller
customer_reviews.text: It was an awesome stroller while it lasted . I believe the frame broke but maybe that's because I'm always walking , so maybe this isn't a stroller you'd walk to the park with kids everyday . But I did get good use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan V.

customer_reviews.title: Great travel compact stroller
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight and well built. We have used it for over 1 year with trips around the world without any issue. There is one design flaw that the front wheels fold up and touch the canopy. As a result, the canopy gets dirty. We have seen it on other people's stroller as well. Wish Chicco can find a solution for it and it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wong

customer_reviews.title: The best out there!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any mom or grandma! Very light weight, small, and easy to store, and the best part; extra tall handles so you don't have to slump over!! Highly recommend! I keep mine in my trunk at all times!
customer_reviews.author: JES

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for airline travel and gate check
customer_reviews.text: On our trip to Florida with our 15 month old twins we needed something to use in the airport and to gate check between flights. These worked AWESOME, light weight, easy to open and close and were literally a great help for us...
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. Very lightweight, easy to fold. Only downside would be there is no cup holder.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Penfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Stroller
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stroller before moving overseas and it is a great little travel stroller. I carry both the stroller and my 1-year-old up and down 4 flights of stairs everyday and it is light and folds up easy. It maneuvers the uneven sidewalks well & is easy enough to pick up if there are stairs. In the states I always use a big jogging stroller - but for travel, this has been a great option. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the basket underneath could be bigger and the handles could be adjustable. They work fine for me at 5'6", but I could see that being a concern for a taller person.
customer_reviews.author: cocoamama

customer_reviews.title: Straps too short
customer_reviews.text: Waist straps were too short for our 6 month old, who is only 16 lbs. I couldn't imagine getting a toddler into this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Scheuermann

customer_reviews.title: Super light stroller
customer_reviews.text: It is really wonderfully light and very easy fast. It is also a great height for tall mothers,requires no bending at all. Overall I'm very satisfied how sturdy,light,and easy to maneuver it is. Also the storage mesh has a good capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Levi H. Noir

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: It’s good but it’s very limited to bent down n makes sound on wheels
customer_reviews.author: Tsering y.

customer_reviews.title: Good with very little recline
customer_reviews.text: Seems good after a few uses. Sturdy and relatively light weight. The recline is only a couple of inches...kind of like economy airlines seats only less.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stroller on the go. Very light and easy to fold. Your baby has to be around 20 pounds for him to start using it! Otherwise is to big.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia spangel

customer_reviews.title: ejgc79
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, I recommend it seems very good quality was what I needed excellent excellent excellent excellent product, I recommend it seems very good quality was what I needed excellent excellent excellent
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Galindez

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight stroller and classy, too...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great stroller. Stop looking for others and just buy this one. The fabric is wonderful and the stroller is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: HEA, Always

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, easy to drive, incredibly light to take in and out of your car trunk. Used on a long domestic flight and it was a walk in the park. Also, great design.
customer_reviews.author: Ebenezer Scrooge

customer_reviews.title: Awkwardly short straps make it unusable
customer_reviews.text: The stroller overall works fine for a nice price point. However, the straps are freakishly short and make it almost unusable. My son is 20 months. Although we still use it I find myself only buckling 1 side often.
customer_reviews.author: Corali

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on any other umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on any other umbrella stroller. This is the best one! Taller, better wheel control, comfort, everything-- is better
customer_reviews.author: Jud Callaway

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller for a trip and like it better than the big, bulky travel system stroller (we have the Cortina). No, there's not as much room for "stuff" (smaller basket underneath, no cup holders, etc.) but it is so easy to fold and takes up SO much less room in the car than others. Plus, it is much sturdier than other umbrella type strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Mere

customer_reviews.title: City Living and Airport Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great portable stroller for city living. We use this and a regular full size stroller depending on what we are doing. It worked great for airport travel, and works great for city living (subways, etc).
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Great travel stroller. Very light, easy close, easy open, and nice looking. The sun shade is perfect and the travel bag will come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: alison daly

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what it states; very light to carry and easy to fold/unfold. One only tiny problem is, when you fold it with the canopy, the wheels touch it leaving dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Uriel Rozenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great for air travel
customer_reviews.text: It's super light, which works well for travel/in airports. I'm 5'7 and my feet do kick the wheels sometimes, and my husband (5'10) feels like he hunches over a bit while pushing it. However, if you're using it for air travel once in awhile - I would definitely recommend it. If you travel a lot (and you're 5'7 or taller!), you may want to invest in one of the higher end umbrella strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick trips!
customer_reviews.text: Great product especially for airport travel or going thru museums! It folds up nice and easy and can be put in a carrying bag which is one of the things I like most about it! Don't count on there being a lot of storage, remember "quick trips" and just use a decent sized diaper bag=)
customer_reviews.author: arobeson0922

customer_reviews.title: Love the stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love the stroller!!!!Perfect for travelling (by plane). Very skinny. Easy to fold. Fits everywhere!!!!My son is 4, he loves the stroller and I do too!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anzhela

customer_reviews.title: This stroller was horrible. The frame was cheap and the umbrella on ...
customer_reviews.text: This stroller was horrible. The frame was cheap and the umbrella on the top was almost impossible to put on. The cost for this stroller was way over priced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: I was so disappointed when it came in
customer_reviews.text: The product description states that the origin is USA. Nope! I was so disappointed when it came in. It is made in China. While it may not matter to most people, I like supporting American manufacturers. Quality wise, everything about it feels cheap. Adequate for the job and nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: Basel

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller hands down...
customer_reviews.text: Best stroller hands down. Five years, dozens of flights...get it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Internicola

customer_reviews.title: better value than $1 store strollers
customer_reviews.text: It's much stronger than any stroller from a dollar store but it's terrible anyway. My back hurts from bending because the handles are too short and they don't extend. I keep kicking the wheels and I am afraid I might trip if walking too fast (they are set apart rather narrowly). It is difficult too buckle up, the middle strap's (the one between legs) buckle is sitting way too low and I would add a remowable front bar to protect a child from falling out. Looking for a replacement and no, I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Siewierska

customer_reviews.title: The Right Balance For Travel
customer_reviews.text: The Capri Lightweight stroller is a good balance between weight, size and durability. We took it overseas to visit family and it held up to the rigors of travel well. Our son loves using it. The only reason for the 4 star review is that for me it isn't quite tall enough, but to be fair I'm 6' 8". I would say anyone 6' 4" or shorter would be able to comfortably push this stroller. It's super easy to fold away and has a basic reclining feature which works well for longer uses. I would purchase it again for travel, but at my size I'll be using our full-sized stroller more often.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheels roll easily, and the sunshade hood goes on without any ...
customer_reviews.text: Very compact umbrella style stroller. Wheels roll easily, and the sunshade hood goes on without any effort. It fits nicely in my trunk and is super lightweight getting it in and out . I strongly recommend this stroller .
customer_reviews.author: TALK OF THE TOWNE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stroller!!!! Perfect size for any vehicle!! We use it everywhere we go!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: great stroller
customer_reviews.text: lightweight, collapses easily, and good quality I even backed up over it in the car and it still works great
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: We bought this for our daughter's family when she had ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter's family when she had her first baby. It has served them well for wo children.
customer_reviews.author: James Manes

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality and design. The only complaint i have is a canopy. I had a hard time to install it. There should be a better way to put it on or remove it.
customer_reviews.author: PLCC

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller.
customer_reviews.text: Great umbrella stroller. Tires roll smoothly on both dirt and pavement. I've used this both in my yard and at the mall. Only setback is it does not have a cup holder, which most umbrella strollers do not have.
customer_reviews.author: DSan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My bison loves it and I do too. Light weight easy open and close, smooth ride and the height of it makes it easy for taller people to prevent the back pain from it being too low
customer_reviews.author: Mary W.

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, better than typical umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great! It's lightweight, easy to maneuver, and collapses and opens easily. If you are looking for an umbrella stroller that is more than an umbrella stroller, get this one. The only drawback is the limited storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nickstr

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Okay, had a Chicco years ago for my older children...and I loved them. But for some reason they do not make them the same anymore . Makes me sad. You would think with time they would get better but in this case they did not. The product is still made well but the features have been tampered with. They are no longer made for tall people, with long handles and they no longer recline all the way back for sleeping. instead handles are shorter and stroller only reclines have way down. Why mess with a good thing. Its no longer quality that matters but quantity. Its sad.
customer_reviews.author: eagle3

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this stroller for my toddler. Sun shade is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Mitsutech27

product_meta.title: Chicco C6 Stroller, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Chicco Ct 0.6 Lightweight Stroller is equipped with a padded five-point harness, multi-position reclining seat, and an adjustable, removable canopy. All-wheel suspension and locking front swivels help maintain a smooth ride from surface to surface. Best of all, the Ct 0.6 has a compact fold, weighs only eleven pounds and comes with a travel-friendly carry strap and bag for on-the-go convenience. 

• Padded 5-point harness
• Multi-position reclining seat
• Adjustable/removable canopy
• All-wheel suspension
• Locking front swivels
• Compact fold
• Carry strap 
• Travel bag
• Storage basket
• Weighs only 11 lbs

BRAND STORY
By Chicco
feature_bullets: Lightweight, aluminum frame, only 11 pounds. Open Dimensions: 31.75L x 18.75H x 40.25W inches, Folded Dimensions: 10.2L x 8.07H x 45.5W inches, Front wheel diameter: 5.75 inches, Rear wheel diameter: 5.75 inches.
Rounder, roomier canopy, adjustable and removable;Storage basket
All wheel suspension and front wheel swivel locks, take it . Fashionable carry bag and carry strap, easy to transport
Padded five point harness and multi position reclining seat, safe and comfortable
Fabrics may be spot cleaned with a damp cloth. Plastic or metal parts may be cleaned with a damp cloth and mild soap; towel dry
